div.span: Adapted from Inventory of Greek Coin Hoards

div.pre: 1737 Kabala, Kutkashen raion, c. 80 km. NW of Shemakha (in anc. Albania), Azer- baidzhan, 1966 Burial: 125-100 B.C. (M) Contents: 593+ AR Alexander III: 7 dr. Imit. Alexander III: 4 tetradr., 436 dr. Lysimachus: 2 post. tetradr. (Byzantium) Seleucus IV: 3 tetradr. Antiochus IV: 16 tetradr. Antiochus V: 7 tetradr. Demetrius I: 43 tetradr. Alexander I Bala: 17 tetradr. Demetrius II: 2 tetradr. Antiochus VI: 2 tetradr. Antiochus VII: 36 tetradr. Seleucid imit.: 3 tetradr. Mithradates I, Parthia: 4 dr. (as Sellwood 10-11, 2 ea.) Phraates II: 1 dr. (as Sellwood 16) Diodotus I, Bactria: 1 tetradr. Eucratides I: 4 tetradr. Disposition: Baku Babaev-Kaziev, NE 9 (1971), pp. 16-32, illus. The coins are described according to Ba- baev and Kaziev
